alert.note: Alert for Clark; Crawford; Edgar; Jasper (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Central Illinois (Central and East Central Illinois)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued March 31 at 9:34PM CDT until March 31 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Central Illinois
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 945 PM CDT FOR CRAWFORD...SOUTHEASTERN EDGAR...SOUTHEASTERN JASPER AND EASTERN CLARK COUNTIES... At 933 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Newport to near West Liberty, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...70 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect considerable tree damage. Wind damage is also likely to mobile homes, roofs, and outbuildings. Locations impacted include... New Hebron and Flat Rock. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 141 and 154. THUNDERSTORM DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...70 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 200 AM CDT for southeastern and east central Illinois. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
